column1: Report Title: Estimated number of persons under correctional supervision in the U.S., 1980-2013
Data source: National Prisoner Statistics (NPS) Program
Estimated number of persons under correctional supervision in the U.S., 1980-2013

a/Includes incarcerated population (jail inmates and prisoners) and population under community supervision (probationers and parolees). Several adjustments have been made to prevent the double counting of individuals with dual correctional population status: starting in 1998, probationers who were incarcerated in jail or prison were removed from the total correctional population count; starting in 1999, prisoners housed in local jails were removed from the total incarcerated and total correctional population counts; starting in 2005, parolees who were incarcerated in jail or prison were excluded from the total correctional population count; and starting in 2008, parolees who were also on probation were removed from the total correctional population count.
b/Starting in 1999, the total incarcerated population was adjusted to exclude prisoners who were being housed in local jails.
c/Starting in 2008, the total community correctional population was adjusted to account for persons on probation and parole at the same time.
Sources: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Annual Survey of Jails, Annual Survey of Probation, Annual Survey of Parole, Census of Jail Inmates, and National Prisoner Statistics, 1980-2013.
